website_summaries.verdict: Netgear's big beefy dual-band router delivers the fastest throughput we've seen on the 2.4 GHz band, which many of your consumer electronics devices probably use.
pros: Great throughput at both 2.4 and 5 GHz bands

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended to any Virgin Media customer
customer_reviews.text: Virgin Media Customers, I can't recommend using an external router enough. I had an instant improvement in wireless performance with this router. Got a much stronger, faster & reliable signal with all my devices around the house especially with the dual-band wireless, 5GHz is so much better if your device supports it. The router was super easy to set up, really clean sinple UI. Put your Virgin Media Hub into "modem mode" plug the router in and it does the rest. You can of course tune the settings if you know what your doing.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Powley

customer_reviews.title: Fuss free to install and provides an improved signal over ISP supplied router.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to connect and install (like the Netgear DM200 Modem I previously purchased). Provides a quick and easy way to add wireless to the DM200 modem (or any modem I presume). Stronger signal than supplied router from Talk Talk. Was up and running in about 5 minutes. Only later installed Firmware update. Good price, nicely packaged, easy to install with software wizard. No complaints, recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ASB68

customer_reviews.title: Buy One now!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone with a virgin router and the problems that go with those pieces of crap, buy one of these!! I can see improved browsing speed, stability, I can get to my settings without an hours wait for that virgin thing to load and it is simplicity itself to set up. Even though I am 20 years in IT I can see they have made it very nice and simple to enable with the virgin kit. Why Virgin can supply something like this themselves is absurd!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Delany

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few months now and it works a treat for me. I’m not techno minded and was just looking for a way to increase my WiFi signal in the house/garden. This unit was easy to set up and as I am using a virgin media router it appears to have increased what I was looking for. Decent WiFi speed for a travel router and if you are technically minded you can set it up as it’s own network in hotels etc. All in all, happy with this product for my intended use.
customer_reviews.author: paul hutton

customer_reviews.title: I'm hoping it is defective!
customer_reviews.text: This is a definite poor buy! It connects and sets up easily enough but the internet signal that it carries is of really poor quality. Videos freeze, downloads begin really fast and slow to a crawl and even fail because of this item. I'm hoping that it is because it is defective and will be seeking a replacement item to check that out, as I have updated the firmware and reset and carried out the set up to the letter 3 times now.
customer_reviews.author: Shinehead69uk

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent buy and is cheap as chips compared with cutting ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this router for a year now with a Virgin Media hub. My home network includes megabit and 10/100 wired devices plus mobile devices on both 2.4 and 5GHz bands. The router has functioned flawlessly. Unless you have the kit to benefit from 802.11ac, which this router does not offer, this is an excellent buy and is cheap as chips compared with cutting edge devices. It is also not affected to the security vulnerabilty which affected some Netgear routers earlier this year.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not as amazing as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I cant say I am that impressed. I purchased this to replace my Superhub 2ac Virgin stock router and TBH the range is probably worse. Its not terrible but wasnt worth the money really and of course being Virgin I have to run it alongside by Superhub As I write this my 100Mb Virgin service is only able to get about 40Mb from just a few feet away on wifi. On the plus side it is easy enough to setup and looks solidly made, but all in all it wasnt really worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. Long

customer_reviews.title: Another good reliable Netgear wifi hub
customer_reviews.text: Another good reliable Netgear wifi hub. I use it to cover a downstairs area of about 300 sq metres and don't lose signal in any of that area even though I have put it at the far end of the house. I am sure devices with more tentacles than an octopus provide faster streaming, but as with most things on a Cat6 gigabit network, it is the ISP that is the weakest link. The dual band is vital in an age of multiple of multiple wifi enabled devices (phones, tablets, laptops, Nintendo, Sony PSP, etc.) and even when connecting an 802.11b device, I haven't seen any noticeable reduction in speed on other devices.
customer_reviews.author: ForiegnNational

customer_reviews.title: Straight forward to install and works perfectly with a good wifi coverage (stronger than my router)
customer_reviews.text: Straight forward to install and works perfectly with a good wifi coverage (stronger than my router). Having tried other options, which have all been unreliable, I am very happy to recommend this device. The only concern is that it projects a fair way from the power socket and could be vulnerable to damage from children or careless adults if not placed in a sheltered position.
customer_reviews.author: MartinDP2

customer_reviews.title: Very useful if you're mobile a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use when my wife and I are on campsites which provide wifi. It enables us to connect multiple devices (laptop, phone, tablet) to the router, then connect the router through to the wife. This removes the requirement to obtain wifi logins and passwords for each device - invaluable where the wifi isn't free!!! Setup is pretty straightforward, and once this is done, it just sits there and works away.
customer_reviews.author: nmckie

customer_reviews.title: Jury's Out
customer_reviews.text: Tried to set this (what appears to be simple) gizmo up, entered the password issued, no luck. Despite this being a simple Home requirement, what could go wrong? Password wasn't recognised. That's the one they issued me with by e-mail. Grateful that I actually had contact with another human when I rang their number, I spent 2 hours (yes, that's two whole hours of my life I won't get back) trying to make myself understood, as well as understanding what he was saying. In the end, it was agreed that if I sent it back to their reclaim centre, they'd send me a replacement. Is this an outfit that exists to wind us up? Time will tell......
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great product with good range
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this product, is very easy to install and set up, with a good design, and makes a big difference to wifi accessibility. I use it at work to hook onto The Cloud, and it has no problems logging on to a public network. Also covers a good distance, as the original router must be at least 25m away, with 3 thick walls in between. Didn't use to be able to log on to the network at all from my office and now can browse the web with no noticeable lag, even able to stream videos.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it - far too complicated
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to set up. I expected a 'Plug and Play' extender which worked right out of the box just as my other NetGear 'extender' and 'switch purchases'. (It also did not resemble the current range of NetGear products so i wonder if it will be superseded soon.) This one appears to be too complicated and the instructions are far from easy to understand, especially since it did not do what the instructions said it would! Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Fizzycyst

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant. I needed a router that would extend the internet from downstairs to upstairs as the walls are thick. It's worked great. The ONLY drawback I have found from this device is that when a computer/laptop is connected via Ethernet to the router, my internet speed looses 10mbs. With the Ethernet cable running from my router downstairs straight to a computer/laptop, I regain the 10mbs. Luckily I always get 90+mbs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Geri

customer_reviews.title: Get it. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Good buy. I have replaced a router supplied from my broadband provider with this one. The range has increased dramatically. It's fast and reliable. Plus, a gigabit connection works like a dream with my network hard drive. You also get a dual band, very practical if you want to split bandwidth to be used by different users. One thing to rememer it is a router without modem so you need to get external modem to use internet.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: So good I'd forgotten it was there!
customer_reviews.text: This unit sits quietly in the corner and just competently goes about its business. 2.4 and 5 GHz frequencies both give good performance. It has now been working for several months without the need for rebooting delivering the full speed of 200 Mbs through my hardwired devices, less through wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E

customer_reviews.title: Really good piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Got this for when I'm out and about and there is only one device allowed to be connected to the internet at once. This fits the bill perfectly. This connects to the internet connection where ever you are and then your devices connect to the Netgear. This one is a replacement as the first started to drop the connection. I must say Amazons support is brilliant. I contacted them by email on a Friday evening, got a response the same evening to say the were replacing it, it was delivered on the Sunday.
customer_reviews.author: Steveh

customer_reviews.title: Great bit of kit. A good step up from the 3400 dual i was using before.
customer_reviews.text: I needed GB Ethernet upgrade for everything I'm running. Had 100Mbps before. I doubled ISP connection and wasn't keeping up (with older router). Menu system greatly improved as is the PC software supplied. Wireless range similar (5Ghz still not great but covers house). Very easy to set up. No significant issues. Seems to be able to operate the USB drive in back much better than previous router. Pros : Easy setup, Good DLNA support (can play USB stuff on anything on network as if local) PC software can do most of the work for you. Can configure 'any' Dynamic DNS service, not tied in. Does what is says on box. Cons: None I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: Musicmac

customer_reviews.title: Travel router
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 requirements which led me to choose the Trek. First was the wifi range in my house was not good so I needed an extender. Second was that when travelling in a motorhome I needed a wifi hub so I can connect several devices to one connection. And it needed 12v or mains. The trek can be USB powered or mains, so that was fine. It works extremely well! I found it easy to set up, and once set up all my devices just connect to it. I would recommend it to anyone needed a small portable device.
customer_reviews.author: JeffO

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant little adapter
customer_reviews.text: This brilliant little wifi adapter is perfect for travel or at home. I've been using it for both situations for a while now and it still surprises me how strong its wifi signal is compared to its size, and it is at least as good as some other units I've tried which have been considerably more expensive. Once it is set up future use is quite simple and when travelling I only need to use my smartphone or tablet to get it connected to the local network. Obviously there is the benefit of improved wifi but it's also more secure than logging on directly to the hotel or public network and I won't travel without it.
customer_reviews.author: A Smile and a Wave

customer_reviews.title: Signal seems fine - I also have an old WD drive attached ...
customer_reviews.text: Signal seems fine - I also have an old WD drive attached to the USB port which we use for file-sharing in the house. This works pretty well with the readyshare utility which means I see the WD as a drive on both mac and windows. Note the ports USB are not powered. They cope ok with the powered WD drive and a sandisk USB pen drive - but not with a portable 1TB HDD which is not powered.
customer_reviews.author: Constrictor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kit plus here is the fix for wifi drop off
customer_reviews.text: found this to be an excellent piece of kit until it started dropping wifi connection. This seems to be an ongoing issue. Contacted Netgear via their Chat system and had it resolved very quickly. The changes where: Speed changed to 145 MTU dropped to 1400 Speed defaulted back to 300 after rebooting but MTU stayed at 1400 Touch wood the router has been stable and locked on since whereas before it dropped anywhere from every 30 seconds to a few minutes. This fix isn't documented anywhere so worth noting and its easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: K. Caveney

customer_reviews.title: Good product, though it could be made out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, though it could be made out of a more rebust material and it's very slow to initialise. If you're looking for a product that connects quickly to an existing network then this is not the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Scribe73

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my upstairs D-Link which was connected via my Netgear AV500s to extend my broadband in my house from my Virgin Media Superhub 2ac, however the D-Link Ethernet Ports bottlenecked the speeds, leaving me with 5 meg download and 1 meg upload from the original 200meg broadband which is based downstairs in my dense wall house. This allows me 70 meg download and 12meg, a substantial upgrade in speeds.
customer_reviews.author: miss s l mason

customer_reviews.title: Good for less than 10 wifi devices
customer_reviews.text: It was reasonably priced and worked really great until i got more than 10+ smart devices that connects to wifi (ps4, tv, smart light bulbs, laptops and phones). So now sometimes devices loose the connection or it gets really slow and i need to reboot router itself.
customer_reviews.author: Linas

customer_reviews.title: The setup process from a mobile phone is far from easy, and doesn't see to be especially stable
customer_reviews.text: I've only been able to get this set up once properly when I've been on holiday, out of several attempts in different hotels. The setup process from a mobile phone is far from easy, and doesn't see to be especially stable, or to take into consideration the variety of ways in which hotel wifi is set up. Not as good as I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Careful shopper

customer_reviews.title: Doubled the speed of my old Netgear Router!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Netgear Router for years which last week thought it would stop giving me wifi for some reason. As I have it connected to,my Sky modem for Netflix etc, I wanted the same but better. This one connected in about 5 mins from opening the box and results are nearly double what I got with the old one. Can change DNS easily as well plus I use the higher frequencies for my Amazon Prime TV and can now watch without any buffering plus Plex with maximum settings which is a bonus. 5 stars from me and very quick delivery as always from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Davy

customer_reviews.title: a very good travel router with a long wifi range
customer_reviews.text: a very good travel router with a long wifi range. The product is no longer produced. it convert an Ethernet LAN to WIFI, works as repeater. The WISP mode allows to play wifi Client and put all your devices in ist own Network behind a NAT. i have it with me at every travel and it worked flawless all the time.important to update to last firmware an set RIP-protocol only incoming and off.
customer_reviews.author: Markus Rieglhofer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router ideal for congested wifi areas.
customer_reviews.text: I work in a building with more than 20 other wireless networks and all previous wireless routers struggled to work well in such a congested location. I'm not an expert of wifi technology but this one however seems to be able to manage much better with the 5G network never dropping out. The setup is simple and I especially like the ability to setup a guest wifi network allowing clients to use it without having access to our network.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Purves

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant piece of kit.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little piece of kit, Works brilliantly as a range extender within my house and I plan on taking it abroad this year to the hotel, as the hotel only has WiFi in selected areas I'm hoping I can grab hold of it for inside my room! I've not come across any problems with the setting up of the device, but I am quite experienced with networking in general, all in all it probably only took around 10 minutes to set-up. Very reccomended
customer_reviews.author: SeptianUK

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant upgrade from the standard Virgin Superhub
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant upgrade from the standard Virgin Superhub. Significant boost in range, one room went from intermittent disconnects and poor speeds to nearly full speed and no disconnects. Also had an issue with the PS4 randomly disconnecting when wired to the Supherhub, now that it's wired to the WNDR4500 there have been no problems at all. Really easy to setup port forwarding, etc. and the free Genie app is actually quite useful for figuring what channel's are free and taking signal strength tests in different rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We have a Virgin Superhub 2 which is rubbish. Stuck that in modem mode and hooked up this bad boy. Bosh. Much wider WiFi range. More stable. Better and consistent speeds. Plus you have the phone app and extras for parental lockdown, traffic stats, guest WiFi settings etc... LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Crybaby

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: When my last wifi router gave up the ghost I dreaded having to look around for a new one. But after the necessary looking around I settled on this brand and so far so good. It seems to work fine with broadband cable and has all the options I need for the mix of new and slightly dated wifi devices I use. The difference between the 2 speeds is only noticeable if you switch between devices but this slight drop in speed is much more preferable than not having the option to connect to the same network. So it's a handy option!
customer_reviews.author: Amberly

customer_reviews.title: USB port does not print via Mac
customer_reviews.text: Whilst the basic setup of the route is straightforward, and it generally does a good job, do not buy this product if you want to use the router to print via the USB port. If you use Mac, the software you need to download doesnt work, and therefore the fact the product description states you can print to mac and PC is false. I've checked in various forums and the issue with the software is known and acknowledged by Netgear, but they clearly haven't gotten around to removing this statement from their product description. Very unhappy with Netgear as using the USB port to print was one of the main reasons I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Rather limited success so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have not,so far, succeeded in: a) Extending the coverage of my wi-fi network, or alternatively b) connecting a USB Printer via wi-fi to the network. According to the documentation, either of these functions should be possible. I have spent quite a lot of time trying for each of these operations and will continue to persevere. I rarely experience much difficultywith such matters, so this has been rather disappointing. The Trek is nicely made and finished; I still look forward to persuading it to function as described.
customer_reviews.author: MR G W SCOTT-GILES

customer_reviews.title: Save your time and your money
customer_reviews.text: the marketing information suggests that this is the solution for internet and wifi that all travellers need. In reality, it is hard (and very slow) to use and the signal strength is only slightly better than before. I was really looking forward to getting my hands on this - I should have not bothered. Another piece of tech going into the bin
customer_reviews.author: nobby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect internet connection for road warriors
customer_reviews.text: A colleague recommended this to me. We both spend a lot of days on the road. Last year, probably over 160 nights in hotels. So, you have a smart phone, laptop and a Firestick. Every hotel, sometimes every night, you have to get a wifi login. With this, you log into the admin page through your laptop, once per session. Every device can now log into the Netgear. The added advantage is that there is a firewall between the Netgear and all your devices.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Boardman

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Router with Fast WiFi Signals
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement on wifi speeds compared to my previous router, especially on the 5Ghz channel. Easy to set up and the Genie app on Android is a useful tool to diagnostic / speed testing around the house. As noted in other reviews, this is not a "modem router". I've got it plugged into my KC Lightstream fibre connection which it detected and connected to without problems
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Donkin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent software installation
customer_reviews.text: Worked out of the box as a wireless hub, unlike the 10 year old model I was trying to press into service. Excellent software installation. WIsh I had bought it months ago, for the price it should have been a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: mike r

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade - Virgin Media customer, Parent control's Buggy
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I've noticed that I'm achieving around 220MB with this router, I can confirm the parent control features don't work very well but overall it's a decent router if you looking to upgrade. All you need to do is put the router into router only mode and plug cable into the Ethernet port on the netgear router.
customer_reviews.author: Rhys

customer_reviews.title: Okay product.
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this 5 stars if it had lasted longer. Very easy to set up and use but stopped working after about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Gill Gee

customer_reviews.title: Powerful & easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Sends a powerful signal across the garden & outbuildings from main house. I tried the so called special outdoor repeaters & had nothing but problems in setting them up. This being a Netgear was a doddle
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Poor at parental controls and not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router, easy to set up and works well. However, I bought this new router specifically to enhance my parental controls over my two teenagers. The promotion video suggests you can set time limits for each device connected. This is NOT possible. It lets you set content controls for ALL devices but no time limits for total access. Our BT home hub did allow this control and was a much better parental tool, however, Internet speed was so poor that we have had to go for wireless broadband and can't seem to find a good router with effective parental controls.
customer_reviews.author: K D Sweet

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR PR2000 does everything it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those on the go, provides a private hotspot using a public network/wifi connection, ideal for wifi services that are public and insecure. An added bonus is that if a service charges you for extra devices this device bypasses that and allows you to connect as many devices as you wish, this is down to the fact that it acts as the main connection and the network you are connection to only sees it as one device everything else that hangs off this device is hidden to the outside network.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy with your Virgin Media Super Hub 2? Buy this !!
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased. Vast improvement over my VirginMedia Superhub 2 wifi. Easy to setup, configure and it just works well.Decent security settings too. Can't grumble for the price, just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: It Does Freak'n Everything! (except make coffee)
customer_reviews.text: The most awesome bit of tech I've used in years. Everyone should own one of these. It does everything (you'd expect. No, it won't make coffee)! Honestly, if you work with or use computers, you should own one of these!....it even works off batteries OR charges your phone! Its wired. It's wireless. Its a firewall. Its a switch. Its a bridge. It's a print server. Its anything you want it to be!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Jones

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Never had any problems with this. No more coverage problems from Virgin-supplied hub.
customer_reviews.author: Mac MacLaren

customer_reviews.title: I now have perfect wifi throughout the boat
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow boat on a marina which has wifi for the whole 250 boats. Within my boat the wifi was extremely patchy. Wifi does not penetrate a metal box well. This Netgear kit has solved my problem. I plugged it in connected my laptop too the router and then through to the site wifi. I now have perfect wifi throughout the boat. Very simple to set up and connect and works like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: not stable wifi perofrmance, dropping down over time problems discovering network devices (printer, AV reciever, TV) my virgin media router that I wanted to replace is performing much better Generally disappointing experience with NETGEAR brand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Wired WIFI extender!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad to extend his WIFI via ethernet cable he already had laid into the back room. The great thing is, I was able to configure it at my house and mail it to him all setup so he could just plug & go. and that's exactly what happened! He is very pleased with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: KWS

customer_reviews.title: Great wi-fi extender
customer_reviews.text: I found out about this on Hot UK Deals and needed a extender do bought it. It is much cheaper than other products available and has the added bonus of being able to take away with you. So far we have only used it as a wi-fi extender and it works great. We have decent speeds throughout the house and now have no black spots at all. I would definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: K. Di Francesco

customer_reviews.title: Little Gem
customer_reviews.text: Extender works really well increasing the range of our Superhub. The size is also ideal portability wise and has a very small footprint. Setting up and connecting was extremely easy. I have had this for several months now and it has been going 24x7 with no problems. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and works really well. We had reached saturation point with the Virgin Media Super Hub due to the number of devices in the house. Switched the VM Hub to modem mode and connected it up to the netgear now all devices connect OK , speed and reliability has improved massively. Easy to set up, a few minutes, and to configure
customer_reviews.author: Sunhouse

customer_reviews.title: Buy if bad connection and speed on Virgin wifi.
customer_reviews.text: Virgin Media users highly recommend this. Put your so called superhub in modem mode and use. Have to admit there is much better speed and no problems with connection using this. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Locke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent corporate connection solution
customer_reviews.text: My company IT equipment (RSA SecureID connection) won't allow you to connect via public wi-fi that requires you to login on a landing page. This little chap sorts that out by giving you a secure wi-fi connection to login to. As long as you have your own smartphone or tablet to configure it with, you're laughing. Relatively easy to set up, as long as you're not an IT dinosaur!
customer_reviews.author: Euan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Range Extender
customer_reviews.text: Took less than 5 minutes to setup as a range extender and is now giving me full access to the internet. I tested my connection speeds and I didn't notice any reduction in mb download per second and I'm not losing connection anymore like I used to. The range on this thing seems to be better than my router! Extremely satisfied and would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Sam G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: and at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I had Sky Q installed but the mini boxes kept dropping out. I switched my Virgin Superhub into modem mode and used this as the router instead and have never had a problem since, and at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: dwhe 2

customer_reviews.title: I was using an ISP provided router which was pretty useless. The range is good
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this. I was using an ISP provided router which was pretty useless. The range is good, it doesn't drop connection and looks nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Ladydarling

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wifi sharing device.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for sharing a wifi connection e.g. Some hotels will charge by the device connected. Use this as the single connected device and then connect all you devices to this. It will also add an additional layer of NAT security.
customer_reviews.author: Spark1

customer_reviews.title: Good, but rather large.
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced a BT Home Hub which had started to give trouble. I have had Netgear routers before which was the reason for my choice. It was easy to set up and works well. My only criticism would be that compared to the Home Hub it is quite large and needs to be placed discreetly within a living area to avoid being obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. P. M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed but as I needed the router continued to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't use parental control features on this router at all on a virgin media cable setup. Disappointed but as I needed the router continued to use it instead of returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Williams

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up and hasn't failed me yet ...
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up and hasn't failed me yet (9+ months). Wireless range isnt huge but this is really designed for you to be in the same room. Exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Delighted! paid for itself
customer_reviews.text: DELIGHTED! once a search over the Amazon Q & As had taken place (note! the password printed ON the extender) this has been set up as a travel routed several times with 100% success. These locations charge for multiple device access to this has already paid for itself. - I will update if there are issues but so far - very good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: During my problem with internet provider modem - Wi-Fi signal ...
customer_reviews.text: During my problem with internet provider modem - Wi-Fi signal was cutting down data transfer - I decided to buy that Netgear - now I do not have any problem with Internet on WI-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: Add1

customer_reviews.title: Far better
customer_reviews.text: The max I could get with the VM hub was 40mb and an awful range. I now use the hub in modem mode, this netgear r6220 has doubled the range so I no longer need the ranger extenders and I get the full 70mb download speed I pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, I use it mainly as a USB file server and lan to wifi repeater. Works great hiding behind 1MAC address when sharing someone else's wifi/hotel wifi hot spots. Working in IT id like to use it in different ways on different days so have to reconfigure each time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Have had this product for nearly 2 years now still working, chugging away in the background, have had no real problems with it. The only issue is aesthetically the plate on the left-hand side means it doesn't quite fit where I wanted to go in my house! In the interface works well and provides all the features required to manage this hardware. All-round a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Topcheese

customer_reviews.title: Good, but why no US plug for a TRAVEL router?
customer_reviews.text: A bit miffed that it comes with only UK & Euro plugs and you can't buy a US plug for it here (no reply from NetGear at all on this point). However, the unit will take an IEC figure-of-8 connector so a lead with any plug on the other end will work.
customer_reviews.author: William Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Just a couple of quibbles: it doesn't flash the front lights to indicate activity and it doesn't have a CLI (the fix doesn't work). Interface is rather slow, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Many thanks it was for a friend & it alls works perfect & fats delivery many thanks, now let's go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have found this great for going out and about as we do often
customer_reviews.text: Have found this great for going out and about as we do often , most are sites with the cloud and always worried about security but with this I not only feel safer but am able to get much better speeds and no drop outs , and I can power it by a small battery, Its a must have for internet around hotspots.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Now enjoying a decent wifi signal everywhere. Takes 5mins to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Our main router is positioned behind a door in out front room - as that is where the phone line comes in, which means we got a flaky signal in about half the house. We now have one these plugged in, in the kitchen and can now get a full or decent connection everywhere - we now have a choice of 2 wifi networks and you can choose the best based on where you are in the house. Bear in mind that if you are using something like Plex to watch movies etc. - this creates a separate wifi network name, so won't extend a signal you can use for that sort of thing.
customer_reviews.author: delarge

customer_reviews.title: Create a sub/private network off the back of an existing WiFi or just extend the range
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a wireless to wireless device to allow a small home network to work privately off the back of another wireless network. Thank goodness I was also looking for a range extender. This is just what I needed. It can be used for either.
customer_reviews.author: L. Benton

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We rent apartments when abroad and this makes it easy for us to hook up all our bits of kit to any free WiFi or access a router in one step. At home it works as a range extender when we are outside for a BBQ and need some extra range for our friends.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: what is not to like, it does the job
customer_reviews.text: what is not to like , it does the job, it is unobtrusive and has great range, one of my better choices
customer_reviews.author: Fact before fiction

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: Works Brilliant and I love the 5ghz on my iPhone it's almost the speed of a wired connection. I always use Netgear routers I've had others in the past but Netgears are no.1 for me, working great with Plusnet Fibre Extra currently running at 80/20 The router was very Big, so I did have to remove a upper shelf on my desk to fit it in :-( and it wouldn't lay down as the width of the shelf wasn't wife enough! So make sure you have a biggish space.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Router Upgrade From A Homehub
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router wifi signal strength is far superior compared to the crappy BT home hub 4 I was putting up with. I even upgraded to a home hub 5 and that was even worse. Looks a smart unit too. Don't have anymore drop outs on my smart tv on the third floor.
customer_reviews.author: Rustys

customer_reviews.title: Handy, all the features it claims work. Small ...
customer_reviews.text: Handy, all the features it claims work. Small downside is it takes a little while to start up, also if you change config it needs that slow start up again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best bit is not having to carry around a power ...
customer_reviews.text: very versatile device, I used it in hotels to provide a wifi connection to the internet by connecting it to their lan or wifi. I also use it to provide WiFi access to the industrial machines I program, which mean no network cable for me to trip over (I've killed more that one laptop that way). The best bit is not having to carry around a power supply and power leads because it is all build in. Very neat!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gould

customer_reviews.title: First Class
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, works well, looks good, good price. It's easy to connect new wireless devices. I've connected it to my Sky router and disabled the Sky wireless in favour of this. All of which means when I change my ISP or upgrade to fibre, I don't have to change wireless settings for any of our devices and my Sky router is working much better now it only has one job to do, i.e. deliver my broadband. The gigabit ethernet option has provided a performance boost to my NAS as well. Happy days.
customer_reviews.author: S. FENTON

customer_reviews.title: Great product but flash it with ddwrt if you want the most!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product, the first thing you wan to do is flash this beast with ddwrt, which opens up the possibilities of this router! DO NOT USE STOCK FIRMWARE it just won't cut the the cheese by comparison to ddwrt (which is free)
customer_reviews.author: LukeL

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi preformance and interoperability.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a Wi-Fi access point only. I have found the performance to be excellent with many different devices.
customer_reviews.author: T H Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the Studio/Bar Area Very Pleased great for the Price
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ingle

customer_reviews.title: Super Value
customer_reviews.text: Now this is fantastic. Set it up at home and then used it in Austria , Lanzarote and Malta Hotels. Worked fantastic and even better both our mobiles worked with it as well so instead of just being able to connect the ipad we got 3 connections for the price of one.Fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says on the box. Fast ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says on the box. Fast & efficient, has sped up all my connections compared to its' predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: David Beckett

customer_reviews.title: Quality router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I was fed up with Virgin Media Superhub drop outs. I simply put the Superhub into modem mode and connected this. It was quick and easy. Now I have pretty flawless wifi with better range and reliability and it's fast
customer_reviews.author: Paul D

customer_reviews.title: Why sell an electronic adapter in UK with a continental 2 pin plug attachment?
customer_reviews.text: Just received this item, and am amazed to find that an electronic item sold in UK does not arrive with a UK standard plug. This means that I'll either need to find and purchase the UK version f the replaceable mains connector, or use a travel adapter in UK. I'll be OK in Europe though!!! When I've done this I'll update with review on performance, but not a good start.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Reliable and fast router. Quick and easy to setup and consistently provides reliable network coverage and with useful features like guest network that can be controlled from mobile app.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: A good router for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, my Wifi speed has increased significantly and covers the whole house now. Easy enough to set up with only one initial teething problem but that may have been my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: poor performance
customer_reviews.text: doesn't reach as far as my virgin superhub (which is saying something), get slow speeds with this still.
customer_reviews.author: Matt is so Matt

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Gadget
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to boost the signal strength of a public wifi hotspot that I have struggled to connect to without hanging my iPhone out of the window. The NETGEAR box has no problems picking up the signal and boosts it so that I can now connect to the Internet from the comfort of my armchair. The added bonus is that I can connect multiple devices at the same time
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bit of kit at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This product is really excellent. I have places in the house where the WIFI signal will just not reach through the walls. Internet connection has always been slow even with a fast Virgin connection. The WIFI to my PC is now superfast - I am so glad that I did not look at solutions that were far more expensive. Highly recommended and I will be taking it on holidays as well.
customer_reviews.author: DarronWales

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router!
customer_reviews.text: A VM customer, loving this router! Bought this because of wifi problems and this is absolutely awesome! Would recommend to any Virgin Media customer
customer_reviews.author: ryuzaki

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy for me to set up. I was using it as an extender for my main router. All I had to do was plug a cat 5 cable from the main router in and connect to the net gear and away she went. The only thing I would say is the website listed with the product to edit the router settings doesn't seem to exist anymore so I'm not sure how to edit the settings. The range seems decent on it too.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and configure
customer_reviews.text: Supports AdvancedTomato custom firmware. Very easy to install and configure.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for a client, worked very well, providing a wireless access point for the nanny in a seperate annex/ outbuilding
customer_reviews.author: Gaz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little unit, that really works!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent unit, very easy to set up and use and worked perfectly with my laptops and tablets and phone. Not had a chance to use it while travelling yet, but will do so at the first opportunity!
customer_reviews.author: mkhead

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made providing a strong, fast signal, although you do need to site it carefully.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made providing a strong, fast signal, although you do need to site it carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Colin The Dolphin

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR PR2000-100EUS Trek Universal N300 Wi-Fi Range Extender
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the router to work. When I followed the instructions I kept getting this message. "Sorry, the website www.routerlogin.net cannot be found." It took some time for the Netgear people to accept this. After I escalated the issue the helpline operative managed to fix the problem - but it took an hour. I haven't had occasion to use it as a Travel Router yet - I hope it's easier than previously.
customer_reviews.author: David Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Wider wifi
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set up and works well as a range extender. - or to use multiple products on a single use hotel paid for wifi (although they are starting to get wise to that dodge!).
customer_reviews.author: Martin

product_meta.title: WNDR4500-200EUS Dual-Band 450 WiFi-N router + 450 Mbps - 4 Gigabit ports
product_meta.description: N900 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars158 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
